title.narrative: 5.1 EDUCATION - EARTHQUAKE RESPONSE

description.narrative: School-aged children of 14 earthquake-affected districts are supported to access quality education during the early recovery period, and children and their communities are provided with resources to strengthen DRR, resilience, and school safety, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By Dec 2017, early recovery and reconstruction efforts will enhance the national and local capacities to a quicker transition in achieving more sustainable outcomes for children and women in the 14 highly affected Earthquake districts with a focus on building resilience, strengthening systems, capacity building and increasing local and national ownership.

participating-org.narrative: EKDARA GA PA GA KA PA OFFICE

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: School-aged children of 14 earthquake-affected districts are supported to access quality education during the early recovery period, and children and their communities are provided with resources to strengthen DRR, resilience, and school safety

description.narrative: 650 Transitional Learning Centers (TLCs) were completed in 337 schools in 10 districts holistic recovery package including supplies, training etc. benefitting 57,731 children (Male: 27,723, Female: 30,008, and 282 children with disabilities). 72 per cent of teachers and 74 per cent of children demonstrated improved knowledge on training in schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Children in severely affected districts accessing temporary learning centers

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 159,900 children (87% of target) in severely affected districts have accessed temporary learning centers.

title.narrative: Teachers working in severely affected districts trained on psychosocial support and dissemination of key lifesaving messages

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 5,474 teachers (68% of target) working in severely affected districts have been trained on psychosocial support and key lifesaving messages.

title.narrative: Children benefitting from emergency Early Childhood Development (ECD) kits and emergency school kits

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 568,380 children (57% of target) have benefitted from emergency ECD and School Kits.

title.narrative: Number of children in targeted schools are provided with education materials
Coordination meetings are held at least quarterly, chaired by DoE on recovery and reconstruction
Number of semi-permanent child-friendly classrooms provided to communities facing major gaps and needs

actual.value: 2017:650 Transitional centers are completed. Out of 250 TLCs 50 TLCs in 8 districts have been allocated and 23 are under construction, and 200 TLC construction to be carried out till June 2018

title.narrative: Strategy and Plan for increasing disaster resilience in Schools in Nepal includes Specific guidelines and response mechanism for 14 most affected districts

target.value: 2017:Strategy/ Plan updated including response mechanism for 14 districts

title.narrative: Workshop held focusing on capacity development with DoE and DEO actors on recovery and reconstruction
Number of District level SMC Federations trained on Training of Trainers (ToT) for SMCs in their district on planning, provision of safe learning spaces including repair and maintenance

actual.value: 2017:This activity will be integrated in the next country programme in strenghthening and safe schools output. As this activity is depended on the completion of the CSS/DRR master plan, and is aligned to the Government's Disbursement Linked Indicators (DLIs).

title.narrative: National communication strategy for community mobilization on safe schools movement is developed

actual.value: 2017:This activity will be integrated in the next country programme in strengthening and safe schools output. As this activity is depended on the completion of the CSS/DRR master plan, and is aligned to the DLIs.

title.narrative: Information Management tool on who is doing what where for recovery is established and updated at least quarterly

target.value: 2017:IM tool functional and reports shared at quarterly

actual.value: 2017:Tool is endorsed fully and is now being used for coordination and sharing of information among the stakeholder by the Government of Nepal for recovery and reconstruction.

title.narrative: Number of teachers, ECD facilitators and SMC members trained on harmonized and comprehensive DRR and school safety package

actual.value: 2017:total of 4,701 teachers, ECD facilitators, SMC and PTA members.
